flags.text: This project guide is not managed by MAKE staff.

guide.introduction:
I have been fascinated with arcs and sparks, bangs and pops ever since I created an arc with a busted power adaptor.

One day I thought about making a proper "big boys' toy" that would be safer and more convenient.
guide.introduction_rendered:
I have been fascinated with arcs and sparks, bangs and pops ever since I created an arc with a busted power adaptor.

One day I thought about making a proper "big boys' toy" that would be safer and more convenient.

Relevant parts
  • 120v-9v transformer
  • Wire
  • Enclosure
  • terminal post
  • Solder
Tools
  • Lighter or heatgun
  • Soldering iron
  • Wire strippers

lines.text: Mains voltage is extremely dangerous and should not be used in this project. Even though the voltage from this project is high enough to arc, it is not deadly.
lines.text_raw: Mains voltage is extremely dangerous and should not be used in this project. Even though the voltage from this project is high enough to arc, it is not deadly.

lines.text: Solder the components according to the diagram.
lines.text_raw: Solder the components according to the diagram.

lines.text: Don't forget to reverse the transformer so that you put power into the output terminals.
lines.text_raw: Don't forget to reverse the transformer so that you put power into the output terminals.

lines.text: Now, put the electronics in the enclosure and make a foot switch.
lines.text_raw: Now, put the electronics in the enclosure and make a foot switch.

lines.text: Finally, put 12v into the input socket and Presto! You have your own high voltage power supply that can be connected to a Jacob's Ladder (basically, put two lengths of coat hanger wire close enough for the arc to jump across at different positions). Have fun!
